DataElement.preferredName: Administration, Management Performed Study Activity Information Source Type Code OMOP CDM Observation Period Type Concept Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager._Executed and carried through to completion._A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it._An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._Knowledge derived from study, experience, or instruction that has been gathered or received by communication._Where something is available or from where it originates._A coded value specifying an identifiable class of an entity or activity based on common qualities._A foreign key identifier to the predefined concept in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the source of the observation period information.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created manually based on BRIDG 5.1 for CDM. 8.27.18 mc

ValueDomain.preferredName: OMOP CDM Observation Period Type Concept Identifier
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A foreign key identifier to the predefined concept in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the source of the observation period information.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ValueDomain.origin: OMOP CDM:The Observational Medical Outcomes Partnership (OMOP) Common Data Model

DataElement.changeDescription: Based on CDMH BRIDG 5.0.2 and OMOP value set for CDM.
